item.title: The Trials of Smooks
item.description: The fact that I’m a hard to please guy explains why I rarely show appreciation for a tool. I easily get frustrated when a tool fails to meet the challenges it’s meant to solve. Smooks is one of the few tools I appreciate. It’s an invaluable transformation framework in the integrator’s arsenal. On a project I was on, I threw at Smooks [1] all manner of challenges, and one after another, Smooks overcame them without giving up a key requirement: maintaining a low memory overhead during transformation.
